1.questionText: I called the airline to ______ my flight reservation a week before I left for Canada.

2.questionText: In order to write a report on stars, we decided to ______ the stars in the sky every night.

3.questionText: Julie wants to buy a ______ computer so that she can carry it around when she travels.

4.questionText: My grandmother likes to surprise people. She never calls ______ to inform us of her visits.

5.questionText: As the tallest building in the world, Taipei 101 has become a new ______ of Taipei City.

6.questionText: Many scholars and experts from all over the world will be invited to attend this yearly ______ on drug control.

7.questionText: John had failed to pay his phone bills for months, so his telephone was ______ last week.

8.questionText: The organic food products are made of natural ingredients, with no ______ flavors added.

9.questionText: Jessica is a very religious girl; she believes that she is always ______ supported by her god.

10.questionText: Jane usually buys things on ______. Her purchases seem to be driven by some sudden force or desire.

11.questionText: The week-long rainfall has ______ landslides and flooding in the mountain areas.

12.questionText: In the cross-lake swimming race, a boat will be ______ in case of an emergency.

13.questionText: The ground is slippery. Hold onto the rope and don't ______.

14.questionText: ______ the weather, the athletic meetings will be held on time.

15.questionText: If people keep polluting the rivers, no fish there will survive ______.

1.questionText: As computers are getting less expensive, they are _______ used in schools and offices today.

2.questionText: Mr. Chang always tries to answer all questions from his students. He will not _____ any of them even if they may sound stupid.

3.questionText: Irene does not throw away used envelopes. She ______ them by using them for taking telephone messages.

4.questionText: Cheese, powdered milk, and yogurt are common milk ______.

5.questionText: Although he is a chef, Roberto _____ cooks his own meals.

6.questionText: Due to the yearly bonus system, the 100 ________ positions in this high-tech company have attracted many applicants from around the island.

7.questionText: If you want to borrow magazines, tapes, or CDs, you can visit the library. They are all ______ there.

8.questionText: The fire in the fireworks factory in Changhua set off a series of powerful _________ and killed four people.

9.questionText: A good government official has to ________ the temptation of money and make the right decision.

10.questionText: The drug dealer was ________ by the police while he was selling cocaine to a high school student.

11.questionText: The rise of oil prices made scientists search for new energy resources to ______ oil.

12.questionText: Without much contact with the outside world for many years, John found many technological inventions _____ to him.

13.questionText: The medicine you take for a cold may cause _____; try not to drive after you take it.

14.questionText: To gain more ______, some legislators would get into violent physical fights so that they may appear in TV news reports.

15.questionText: To live an efficient life, we have to arrange the things to do in order of _____ and start with the most important ones.

1.questionText: If we can ______ to, we will take a vacation abroad in the summer.

2.questionText: A ______ mistake found in parenthood is that parents often set unrealistic goals for their children.

3.questionText: Some words, such as "sandwich" and "hamburger," were ______ the names of people or even towns.

4.questionText: Have you ever ______ how the ancient Egyptians created such marvelous feats of engineering as the pyramids?

5.questionText: Mr. Johnson was disappointed at his students for having a passive learning ______.

6.questionText: Anne dreaded giving a speech before three hundred people; even thinking about it made her ______.

7.questionText: I had to ______ Jack's invitation to the party because it conflicted with an important business meeting.

8.questionText: Selling fried chicken at the night market doesn't seem to be a decent business, but it is actually quite ______.

9.questionText: The passengers ______ escaped death when a bomb exploded in the subway station, killing sixty people.

10.questionText: Jerry didn't ______ his primary school classmate Mary until he listened to her self-introduction.

11.questionText: With the completion of several public ______ projects, such as the MRT, commuting to work has become easier for people living in the suburbs.

12.questionText: With a good ______ of both Chinese and English, Miss Lin was assigned the task of oral interpretation for the visiting American delegation.

13.questionText: I am studying so hard for the forthcoming entrance exam that I do not have the ______ of a free weekend to rest.

14.questionText: Kim was completely ______ after jogging in the hot sun all afternoon; she had little energy left.

15.questionText: When Jason failed to pay his bill, the network company ______ his Internet connection.

1.questionText: The movie director adapted this year's bestseller into a hit and made a ______.

2.questionText: Wang Chien-ming, the Yankees' best pitcher last year, already showed his great ______ for baseball when he was still a teenager.

3.questionText: Although Jeffery had to keep two part-time jobs to support his family, he never ______ his studies. In fact, he graduated with honors.

4.questionText: If it is too cold in this room, you can ______ the air conditioner to make yourself feel comfortable.

5.questionText: This course will provide students with a solid ______ for research. It is highly recommended for those who plan to go to graduate school.

6.questionText: Peter is now living on a ______ of NT$100 per day. He cannot afford any recreational activities.

7.questionText: Amy succeeded in ______ for a raise though her boss didn't agree to increase her salary at first.

8.questionText: Ms. Li's business ______ very quickly. She opened her first store two years ago; now she has fifty stores all over the country.

9.questionText: Ruth is a very ______ person. She cannot take any criticism and always finds excuses to justify herself.

10.questionText: It's a pity that you have to leave so soon. I ______ hope that you will come back very soon.

11.questionText: We human beings may live without clothes, but food and air are ______ to our life.

12.questionText: The manager ______ without hesitation after he had been offered a better job in another company.

13.questionText: Many important legal ______ concerning the tragic incident have now been preserved in the museum.

14.questionText: I'm not sure exactly how much scholarship you'll receive, but it will ______ cover your major expenses.

15.questionText: Tom was very ill a week ago, but now he looks healthy. We are ______ by his quick recovery.

1.questionText: Amy did not ______ changes in the course schedule and therefore missed the class.

2.questionText: It is not easy for old people to ______ their backs, so they need help when their backs itch.

3.questionText: Mary is suffering from a stomachache and needs to eat food which is easy to ______.

4.questionText: Since our classroom is not air-conditioned, we have to ______ the heat during the hot summer days.

5.questionText: Sue is so ______ that she always breaks something when she is shopping at a store.

6.questionText: Ann enjoyed going to the flower market. She believed that the ______ of flowers refreshed her mind.

7.questionText: The profits of Prince Charles's organic farm go to ______ to help the poor and the sick.

8.questionText: Jack was given the rare ______ of using the president's office, which made others quite jealous.

9.questionText: This new computer is obviously ______ to the old one because it has many new functions.

10.questionText: Simon loves his work. To him, work always comes first, and family and friends are ______.

11.questionText: Although your plans look good, you have to be ______ and consider what you can actually do.

12.questionText: Built under the sea in 1994, the ______ between England and France connects the UK more closely with mainland Europe.

13.questionText: This tour package is very appealing, and that one looks ______ attractive. I don't know which one to choose.

14.questionText: Hseu Fang-yi, a young Taiwanese dancer, recently ______ at Lincoln Center in New York and won a great deal of praise.

15.questionText: The police searched the house of the suspect ______. They almost turned the whole house upside down.

1.questionText: John's clock is not functioning _____. The alarm rings even when it's not set to go off.

2.questionText: Michael has decided to _____ a career in physics and has set his mind on becoming a professor.

3.questionText: Peter plans to hike in a _____ part of Africa, where he might not meet another human being for days.

4.questionText: People in this community tend to _____ with the group they belong to, and often put group interests before personal ones.

5.questionText: I mistook the man for a well-known actor and asked for his autograph; it was really _____.

6.questionText: After spending most of her salary on rent and food, Amelia _____ had any money left for entertainment and other expenses.

7.questionText: In the Bermuda Triangle, a region in the western part of the North Atlantic Ocean, some airplanes and ships were reported to have mysteriously disappeared without a _____.

8.questionText: Shouting greetings and waving a big sign, Tony _____ the passing shoppers to visit his shop and buy the freshly baked bread.

9.questionText: With a continuous 3 km stretch of golden sand, the beach attracts artists around the world each summer to create amazing _____ with its fine soft sand.

10.questionText: The clouds parted and a _____ of light fell on the church, through the windows, and onto the floor.

11.questionText: Instead of a gift, Tim's grandmother always _____ some money in the birthday card she gave him.

12.questionText: While winning a gold _____ is what every Olympic athlete dreams of, it becomes meaningless if it is achieved by cheating.

13.questionText: The thief went into the apartment building and stole some jewelry. He then _____ himself as a security guard and walked out the front gate.

14.questionText: Due to numerous accidents that occurred while people were playing Pok√©mon GO, players were advised to be _____ of possible dangers in the environment.

15.questionText: Sherlock Holmes, a detective in a popular fiction series, has impressed readers with his amazing powers of _____ and his knowledge of trivial facts.

1.questionText: Mangoes are a _____ fruit here in Taiwan; most of them reach their peak of sweetness in July.

2.questionText: Writing term papers and giving oral reports are typical course _____ for college students.

3.questionText: If we work hard to _____ our dreams when we are young, we will not feel that we missed out on something when we get old.

4.questionText: Few people will trust you if you continue making _____ promises and never make efforts to keep them.

5.questionText: Becky _____ her ankle while she was playing tennis last week. Now it still hurts badly.

6.questionText: Research shows that men and women usually think differently. For example, they have quite different _____ about what marriage means in their life.

7.questionText: The new manager is very _____. For instance, the employees are given much shorter deadlines for the same tasks than before.

8.questionText: While the couple were looking _____ for their missing children, the kids were actually having fun in the woods nearby.

9.questionText: After delivering a very powerful speech, the award winner was _____ by a group of fans asking for her signature.

10.questionText: The interviewees were trying very hard to _____ the interviewers that they were very capable and should be given the job.

11.questionText: After the first snow of the year, the entire grassland disappeared under a _____ of snow.

12.questionText: Peter likes books with wide _____, which provide him with enough space to write notes.

13.questionText: At the beginning of the semester, the teacher told the students that late assignments would receive a low grade as a _____.

14.questionText: Various studies have been _____ in this hospital to explore the link between a high-fat diet and cancer.

15.questionText: Intense, fast-moving fires raged across much of California last week. The _____ firestorm has claimed the lives of thirty people.

1.questionText: Bobby cared a lot about his _____ at home and asked his parents not to go through his things without his permission.

2.questionText: The new manager is a real gentleman. He is kind and humble, totally different from the former manager, who was _____ and bossy.

3.questionText: The weather bureau _____ that the typhoon would bring strong winds and heavy rains, and warned everyone of the possible danger.

4.questionText: Different airlines have different _____ for carry-on luggage, but many international airlines limit a carry-on piece to 7 kilograms.

5.questionText: Many people were happy that the government had finally _____ Children's Day as a national holiday.

6.questionText: To reach the goal of making her company a market leader, Michelle _____ a plan to open ten new stores around the country this year.

7.questionText: Silence in some way is as _____ as speech. It can be used to show, for example, disagreement or lack of interest.

8.questionText: This TV program is designed for children, _____ for those under five. It contains no violence or strong language.

9.questionText: Tommy, please put away the toys in the box, or you might _____ on them and hurt yourself.

10.questionText: The _____ costume party, held every September, is one of the biggest events of the school year.

11.questionText: In a job interview, attitude and personality are usually important _____ that influence the decision of the interviewers.

12.questionText: The snow-capped mountain is described so _____ in the book that the scene seems to come alive in front of the reader's eyes.

13.questionText: Surrounded by flowers blooming and birds _____ merrily, the Wangs had a good time hiking in the national park.

14.questionText: It is essential for us to maintain constant _____ with our friends to ensure that we have someone to talk to in times of need.

15.questionText: The young generation in this country has shown less interest in factory work and other _____ labor jobs, such as house construction and fruit picking.

1.questionText: After hours of discussion, our class finally reached the _____ that we would go to Hualien for our graduation trip.

2.questionText: Jane _____ her teacher by passing the exam with a nearly perfect score; she almost failed the course last semester.

3.questionText: The vacuum cleaner is not working. Let's send it back to the _____ to have it inspected and repaired.

4.questionText: Due to the global financial crisis, the country's exports _____ by 40 percent last month, the largest drop since 2000.

5.questionText: The potato chips have been left uncovered on the table for such a long time that they no longer taste fresh and _____.

6.questionText: The townspeople built a _____ in memory of the brave teacher who sacrificed her life to save her students from a burning bus.

7.questionText: The students in Professor Smith's classical Chinese class are required to _____ poems by famous Chinese poets.

8.questionText: Although Mr. Tang claims that the house belongs to him, he has not offered any proof of _____.

9.questionText: Ancient Athens, famous for its early development of the democratic system, is often said to be the _____ of democracy.

10.questionText: The candy can no longer be sold because it was found to contain artificial ingredients far beyond the _____ level.

11.questionText: Jack's excellent performance in last week's game has _____ all the doubts about his ability to play on our school basketball team.

12.questionText: It is bullying to _____ a foreign speaker's accent. No one deserves to be laughed at for their pronunciation.

13.questionText: Mary lost ten kilograms in three months, so her _____ skin-tight jeans are now hanging off her hips.

14.questionText: The police officer showed us pictures of drunk driving accidents to highlight the importance of staying _____ on the road.

15.questionText: The claim that eating chocolate can prevent heart disease is _____ because there is not enough scientific evidence to support it.
